result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Amanda R Sanapaw was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Amanda R Sanapaw was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Amanda R Sanapaw was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

Court has no objection to serving the time in Shawano County but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s).
Defendant  must install IID on all vehicles titled in her name and upon issuance of valid drivers license.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any taverns/bars.
Defendant must undergo anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda R Sanapaw

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to Jail
Does not plan to seek.

Defendant Amanda R Sanapaw in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Amanda R Sanapaw in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:08 PM. Lynch and Sanapaw have revocation paperwork, do not see any errors or inaccuracies. State - makes final argument prior to sentencing - has credit for 275 days - recommends on count #3 - 3.5 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, count #5 - 9 months in jail - concurrnt to count #3. Lynch makes argument prior to recommendation - recommends 275 days total on both counts for time served. Sanapaw makes statement, remorseful, asks for time served. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #3 - 1 year in FC jail - - huber and good time allowed (on balance of jail time) - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 275 days; count #5 - 6 months in FC jail - concurrent to count #3 - no objection to serving the sentence in another county but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s), turn any unpaid fines into a civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 7, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: arrested FOSO
#1 - JOC from Shawano County 11CM489; #2 - Certified Driving Record
State's Settlement Recommendation

Defendant Amanda R Sanapaw in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:01 PM. State - this matter is set for JT tomorrow, defendant wishes to enter plea today, Court continued a bench warrant earlier this morning. State - resolved - defendant will plead G to count #1 as alleged, acknowledge one prior conviction, dismiss count #2, on counts #3, #4 and #5 - delete any enhancer and enter g/nc to counts #3 and #5 as amended and dismiss and read in #4, 2 year probation, consecutive to jail time that will be ordered, with conditions of: 120 days jail on count #3, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, 200 hours of community service, anger management, attend at least one AA/NA or similar program each week, $35.00 blood draw costs owed to City of Crandon, provides court with exhibits #1 - certified driving record of the defendant and exhibit #2 - JOC from another county, follow district 9 guidelines on OWI on count #1. Voorhees and Sanapaw agree. Sanapaw pleads G to count #1 as alleged, Court deletes the repeater allegation but remains a second and subsequent offense on count #3, Sanapaw pleads G to count #3 as amended. Court amends count #5 to delete the repeater allegation, Sanapaw pleads G to count #5 as amended. Court dismisses count #2 and dismisses and reads in count #4. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Voorhees makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks court to approach sentence with flexibility for stated reasons, has provided the Court with a sentencing memorandum recently - ask that the defendant be allowed to serve her sentence in Shawano County - asks Court to consider the minimal fine amount and penalties - asks for inpatient treatment time to be part of jail time - asking for time to report for stated reasons. Court makes statement in regards to the matter now not being a joint recommendation. State will stick with its offer as stated previously on the record today. State provides the court with a series of pictures in regards to the time of arrest. Voorhees had no objections. Sanapaw makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #count 1 - $1665.00, 45 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - no objections to serving the time in Shawano County but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s) - credit for 9 days - report today, 14 months DL revocation, AODA, IID on DL and any vehicles titled in her name for 1 year commencing upon issuance of a valid DL; counts #3 and #5 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 200 hours of community service, attend at least one AA/NA or similar type program each week, 120 days jail - consecutive to jail time on count #1 - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m), anger management and follow thru with any recommendations, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, $35.00 blood draw for City of Crandon - paid thru probation, costs - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, no possession of firearms, no voting rights. Voorhees asks for a furlough for the 120 days after the 45 days jail to arrange huber, transfer to Shawano County, etc. Court denies that request, right to appeal, adjourned.

Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:49 AM. State - second time this week that this matter has been set for PLEAS without the client present. Voorhees - has talked to the defendant both on Monday and this morning, states the issues with the defendant getting to court, wants to plead and not got to trial. Court will continue warrant, calls off the jury until the defendant has been picked up. Voorhees has instructed the defendant to still try and get to Court today.
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney John E Voorhees in court.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:37 PM. State - matter is set for JT on 11/3/16 and have witnesses ready to proceed with that. Voorhees - arranged for the PLEAS today and have an agreement but the defendant was having issues finding a ride to Court today, is available by phone to give Court an explanation of her non-appearance, would still like to resolve this case short of JT. Court continues bond, issues bench warrant, body or $3,000.00. State advised to not call off his witnesses at this point, advises Voorhees that defense still has time to hear the matter prior to 11/3/16 and not assess jury fees, will give consideration to the defendant is she can tell the Court why she could not make it today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Jury trial on November 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amanda R Sanapaw in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Amanda R Sanapaw in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:54 PM. Voorhees requests a continuance for stated reasons but advises the Court that the State has made a proposal and the defendant has basically accepted the plea offer and is prepared to enter a plea today. Court will continue bond and sets for JT. State - offer - count #1 - plead to as alleged, 30 days in FC jail, #3 - plead to as alleged, 2 years probation with 120 days conditional jail consecutive to count #1 and #5 - probation as well. Sanapaw agrees and understands what is possible.  Jury trial scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

#1 - JOC from Shawano County Case 11CM489
Final pre-trial on August 3, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Amanda R Sanapaw in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:38 AM. State here for PH, offers JOC from 11CM489 (Shawano) as exhibit #1, no objections, court receives exhibit #1. State calls Officer Darrell Wilson, sworn in 10:39 AM. State directs, 10:40 AM. Identification of witness, 10:43 AM. Cross-examination by Voorhees, 10:50 AM. State - objection, sustainability - over ruled, 10:55 AM. State re-directs, 10:56 AM. Voorhees - objection, leading - over ruled, 10:58 AM. Witness excused, 10:59 AM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Voorhees asks to dismiss count 4, discussion on issues with count 3. State is aware and will remove repeater on count 3, remaining components and counts should remain as is. State files INFO. Will proceed to ARGN, Voorhees has information waives further reading and enters NG pleas to all counts. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Amanda R Sanapaw in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Amanda R Sanapaw in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:36 PM. Voorhees and Sanapaw have complaint and ready to proceed with INIT and would like to address bail. Court reads charges and penalties. Voorhees and Sanapaw understand charges and penalties. Voorhees requests PH but would like to address bond first. State - bond - $2000.00 cash bond for stated reasons. Voorhees - bond - asks Court for signature bond with strict non-monetary conditions or lower cash bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - $5000 signature bond with conditions of no consumption of alcohol.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 09:45 am.
